thread.title: Visit has UGA trending with in-state ATH
thread.title_full: Visit has UGA trending with in-state ATH

title: Visit has UGA trending with in-state ATH
text:
Visit has UGA trending with in-state ATH Offers continue to flow in for this Peach State athlete. 
Wide receiver Marquez Ezzard (Stockbridge, Ga./Stockbridge) is over 20 offers to date, and the Bulldogs are one of the teams standing out early on. 
"Georgia, Auburn, Virginia Tech, that is about it," Ezzard said, on vsporto's SEC Recruiting Buzz. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
Ezzard says his recent visit to Athens, Ga. was his first time checking out the Bulldogs, and the main reason why Georgia is sticking out at the moment. 
"When I went down there on a visit, I met with Kirby Smart , Coach Coley," Ezzard said. "They were excited to get me down there. They showed me around and my family around. We had a good time." 
The 6-0.5, 195-pound wideout feels Kirby Smart has Georgia going in the right direction, especially with how well recruiting is going. 
"I think he is a wonderful coach," Ezzard said. "They have a lot of good players coming in from this 2017 class - they got a good quarterback in Jake Fromm ." 
At the moment, Ezzard has no timeframe for when he might make a commitment. 
"That is a hard question, I do not really know yet," Ezzard said. 
Listen to the full interview above, which Ezzard discussing other programs and includes a breakdown of him as a prospect and insight into his recruitment.
